channel.title: Gustav Janssons devlog
channel.description: This blog is a try to me keep motivates and a way to see my progress on my current projects. Let’s see how it goes!

item.title: Week 06
item.description: This week I found a opensource tracer so I started porting it to c++. I then realized I need to load js like json files and started to update my json loader.

item.title: Week 05
item.description: This week I have been working on game controller implementation. First I wrote most of one implementation and then removed that in favor of a more-code but less complex solution.

item.title: Week 04
item.description: This week I continued working on the input system. Better error handling and working fallback when a connected joystick is lost. Next up is gamepad, rumble and finally 3d rendering again.

item.title: Week 03
item.description: This week more or less nothing was implemented but I watched many GDC presentations.

item.title: Week 02
item.description: This week I continued on the Input System. Another refactoring but I think it’s finally the beginning of the end now

item.title: Week 01
item.description: This week I continued on working on the input system. Getting closer now, hopefully it will be “done” next week.

item.title: Week 53
item.description: This week I continued on working on the input system.

item.title: Wekk 52
item.description: This week I restored the input system from an old project and started integrating it into tred

item.title: Week 51
item.description: This week I got back into 3d rendering. I added basic face culling, simplified the mesh generation a bit and cleaned up the resource embed module. Not much but also not bad :)

item.title: Week 50
item.description: This week I didn’t do much. I created a simple script to backup my git repos and read up on animation.

item.title: Week 49
item.description: This week I switched tred to pitchfork layout and refactored it. I also spent most of my time on the ‘kittens game’, what a time waster.

item.title: Week 48
item.description: This week I looked into the markov-chains parts of euphoria (again), refactored a bit and expanded with a “line” test, a bit of fun really. I also thought about how I want to lay out the vertex attributes in tred. It currently is 100% dynamic butit will be easier if it’s static. A few days I ago I was sure I wanted a 50/50 approach but since I have to deal with all the dynamic issues anyway I might as well benefit from the potential space spacing and use 100% dynamic attributes. Time will tell what I’ll decide.

item.title: Week 47
item.description: This week I worked both a little on ride(scrolling in fileview and expanding folders) and a little bit on tred(refactored profiling and added a plane mesh). Hopefully next week I make some decent progress on tred as I want to get it to a usefule state before the end of the year.

item.title: Week 46
item.description: This week I added cmdlet to new ride and converted euphoria to the pitchfork layout

item.title: Week 45
item.description: This week I refactored the scrolling code and started work on the command palette.
